page.title: 19R A F ST MAWGAN (2)
page.content:
Sergeant Kilkenny and F.O.Dodwell said that most postings lasted for three years.There were a lot of clubs to join in your spare time and whether you lived on or off the base St Mawgan was popular because of its pleasent surroundings.The Americans on the base tended not to mix with the British. In the control tower the radar room was lit with a blue light.Dave Kartmell showed us round and then he
took us up to the control tower.the entire D.block could be seen from here. Sergeant Mace was bring in a helicopter to land.They use bird scarers to keep birds off the runway which is twice the normal with.G.P.O. Rothell said that the base covered 11.25 sq.km. of ground.
